context.challenge: Pioneering health and wellness in the early IoT era.
context.scope: Product Leadership, Lean Methodology, Team Directorship
context.team: 0 to 1M Users in 8 mos, Webby Nomination
context.body: Upwave was Turner's IoT-driven digital health venture, exploring the intersection of quantified-self data and personalized content. As Vice President, Product & UX, I led the specialized teams responsible for taking the venture from concept to market. Partnering with IDEO for initial market validation, I established the product strategy and introduced a lean methodology that enabled daily release cycles, accelerating growth to 1M monthly unique users in just eight months.

sections.label: The Platform
sections.title: An ecosystem of content, challenges, and analytics.
sections.description: I directed the product roadmap and user experience strategy across the entire Upwave ecosystem, guiding teams to ensure a seamless integration between media consumption and health tracking behaviors.

cards.title: Content Strategy & Platform

cards.title: Behavioral Challenges
cards.description: Oversaw the design framework for multi-day wellness challenges, applying behavioral science to daily progress tracking.

cards.title: TrackIt Analytics

sections.label: Market Validation & Delivery
sections.title: From validation to daily releases.
sections.description: Building a platform at the forefront of quantified-self technology (pre-Apple Watch) required rigorous methodology. I initiated a partnership with IDEO to secure product-market fit and validate key assumptions before large-scale investment. Working cross-functionally, I led the transition of the teams to a lean product methodology, establishing a cadence of daily release cycles that increased platform recirculation from 5% to 24%.

cards.title: Architecture Directorship
cards.description: Directed the UX and product teams to establish the foundational information architecture and component strategy.

cards.title: Interaction Systems
cards.description: Managed multidisciplinary teams ensuring complex health data intersections were logically translated into accessible interfaces.

sections.label: Emerging Technology
sections.title: Defining the future of broadcast.
sections.description: Prior to leading Upwave, my tenure at Turner included serving as Senior Director of Innovation & Emerging Technology spanning CNN, Cartoon Network, TBS & TNT. I led multi-disciplinary R&D teams that pioneered early mobile augmented reality applications and the sync-to-TV technology that ultimately won a Primetime Emmy Award. These efforts resulted in two granted U.S. patents for automatic content recognition. I also collaborated on the design of the CNN 'Magic Wall,' introducing a massive multi-touch paradigm that redefined data storytelling across the broadcast industry.
